Job Summary: - The Commis 3 Chef is a foundational role within a professional kitchen, focused on performing basic food preparation tasks while learning essential kitchen operations. As the most junior member of the culinary team, the Commis 3 assists with preparing ingredients, maintaining workstations, and supporting senior chefs during service. This position offers a great learning opportunity for individuals at the beginning of their culinary careers to develop their technical skills and gain experience in a high-paced kitchen environment. Working closely with experienced chefs, the Commis 3 will be exposed to the finer details of professional cooking, while ensuring that hygiene and food safety standards are consistently upheld. The role requires enthusiasm, dedication, and a strong willingness to learn.

Job Description:-
•	 Assist with basic food prep tasks, including washing, peeling, chopping, and slicing vegetables, fruits, meats, and other ingredients.
•	Prepare simple components like sauces, stocks, or garnishes as directed by senior chefs.
•	Aid senior chefs in setting up and maintaining kitchen stations, ensuring that all tools and ingredients are readily available during service.
•	Help in cooking basic items, such as appetizers or side dishes, while following kitchen protocols and recipes.
•	Prepare and organize missed place (ingredients and equipment) to ensure smooth service during busy hours.
•	Monitor stock levels and report any shortages or expired items to senior staff
•	Ensure that workstations are clean and organized at all times.
•	Follow strict hygiene and sanitation procedures, including proper food storage and waste disposal.
•	Clean kitchen equipment and utensils after use, ensuring they are ready for the next shift.
•	Take guidance from more experienced chefs to learn new skills, techniques, and best practices in cooking and kitchen management.
•	Participate in training sessions and apply newly acquired knowledge to daily tasks.
•	Follow all health and safety regulations, ensuring that food is handled, stored, and prepared in a way that minimizes risk to the kitchen team and diners.
•	Assist with maintaining a safe and hazard-free work environment by reporting any safety concerns to supervisors.

Job Qualification: - 
•	Culinary diploma or certificate from a recognized institution is an advantage but not required.
•	Some prior experience in a professional kitchen (e.g., internships, apprenticeships) is helpful.
•	Basic understanding of food safety and hygiene practices.
•	Understanding of basic cooking methods, knife skills, and food preparation techniques.
•	Accuracy in preparing ingredients and following recipes or instructions from senior chefs.
•	Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time efficiently during high-volume service periods.
•	Willingness to work as part of a team, supporting senior chefs and fellow kitchen staff.
•	A strong desire to develop culinary skills and progress in a professional kitchen setting.
